tourBios.exmtStatus: Fully Exempt: # Nearest 50 - 23rd Web.com Tour qualifier at 2012 PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh:
2012: Between May and August, made seven PGA TOUR and seven Web.com Tour starts, missing the cut in each. Did not play much on TOUR for the fifth consecutive season due to neck and shoulder issues that stem from second season on TOUR in 2006...Granted Major Medical Extension...In his eighth and final TOUR start of the season, the Children's Miracle Network Hospitals Classic, ended in style with a T9 at Disney World. Posted a final-round, 6-under 66 to net the top-10 finish.

2011: Returned to competitive play with five starts on the Web.com Tour but did not make the cut in any of the events. 

2006: In second season on TOUR, limited to just six events due to neck and shoulder injuries...Made one cut, a T48 at the Ford Championship at Doral, but did not play again the rest of the season. 2005: Rookie was one of three first-year players to earn more than $1 million (Sean O'Hair and Greg Owen)...First career top-10 came in 17th start on TOUR, a T7 at the Booz Allen Classic...Finished T6 at The INTERNATIONAL, eight points behind Retief Goosen in the Modified Stableford scoring system...Finished season with a career-best fourth-place finish at the Southern Farm Bureau Classic after holding the 54-hole lead by a stroke, his first career lead on TOUR. 2004: Earned initial TOUR card by making it through all three stages of the 2004 PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament, where he finished T13 in the final stage. Had attended Q-school every year since 1996, making it to finals in 1997 and 2004...Played the Gateway Tour in 2002-04 and finished fifth in the 2004 Desert Series money list. 2001: Played Canadian Tour in 2000-01. 1999: Finished 95th on Web.com Tour money list. 1998: Finished 47th on Web.com Tour money list. Posted two thirds, at the Carolina Classic and the Greensboro Open, his best finishes on that Tour. 1997: Played the Asian Tour. Amateur: Two-time honorable mention All-American at Arizona State.
tourBios.personal: Worked on the range and in the bag room at TPC Scottsdale while growing up. Received a sponsor exemption to play in the 2005 FBR Open when FBR Open Chairman Bryon Carney offered him the spot during his wedding rehearsal dinner in late 2004.

tourBios.carHigh:
2013-14: Had two events to earn $435,779, which would equal No. 125 from the 2007 season. Missed the cut in his only start on TOUR. Will have one start in 2014-15 to earn $435,779 as part of the Major Medical Extension.

2013: Made four of 15 TOUR cuts as he continue to play with a Major Medical Extension. His best finish was T21 at the Zurich Classic of New Orleans. 

2012: Between May and August, made seven PGA TOUR starts, missing the cut in each. Did not play much on TOUR for the fifth consecutive season due to neck and shoulder issues that stem from second season on TOUR, in 2006...In his eighth and final start of the season, the Children's Miracle Network Hospitals Classic, ended in style with a T9 at Disney World. Posted a final-round, 6-under 66 to net the top-10 finish.

2006: In second season on TOUR, limited to just six events due to neck and shoulder injuries...Made one cut, a T48 at the Ford Championship at Doral, but did not play again the rest of the season. 2005: Rookie was one of three first-year players to earn more than $1 million (Sean O'Hair and Greg Owen)...First career top-10 came in 17th start on TOUR, a T7 at the Booz Allen Classic...Finished T6 at The INTERNATIONAL, eight points behind Retief Goosen in the Modified Stableford scoring system...Finished season with a career-best fourth-place finish at the Southern Farm Bureau Classic after holding the 54-hole lead by a stroke, his first career lead on TOUR. 2004: Earned initial TOUR card by making it through all three stages of the 2004 PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament, where he finished T13 in the final stage. Had attended Q-school every year since 1996, making it to finals in 1997 and 2004...Played the Gateway Tour in 2002-04 and finished fifth in the 2004 Desert Series money list. 2001: Played Canadian Tour in 2000-01. 1999: Finished 95th on Web.com Tour money list. 1998: Finished 47th on Web.com Tour money list. Posted two thirds, at the Carolina Classic and the Greensboro Open, his best finishes on that Tour. 1997: Played the Asian Tour. Amateur: Two-time honorable mention All-American at Arizona State.
tourBios.personal: Worked on the range and in the bag room at TPC Scottsdale while growing up. Received a sponsor exemption to play in the 2005 FBR Open when FBR Open Chairman Bryon Carney offered him the spot during his wedding rehearsal dinner in late 2004.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was 4th in 2005 at the Southern Farm Bureau Classic.
